text: Nancy Grace Roman (May 16, 1925 - December 25, 2018) was an American astronomer. She was one of the first female executives at NASA. She was known to many as the "Mother of Hubble" for her role in planning the Hubble Space Telescope. Roman died on December 25, 2018 in Washington, D.C. from a long- illness at the age of 93. ==References== ==Other websites== * Oral History interview transcript with Nancy G. Roman 19 August 1980, American Institute of Physics, Niels Bohr Library and Archives * Category:1925 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in Washington, D.C. title: Nancy Roman
